Information Systems in Organisations

In the 21st century all businesses use Information and Communication Technologies to efficiently manage their operations, to help managers make better decisions and achieve competitive advantage. In this module you will learn how to facilitate seamless internal and external communications and use cutting edge techniques to manage the business operations.

Learning Objectives for this module:

+  Demonstrate an understanding of fundamental concepts of information systems, and the role of information systems in operational, tactical and strategic management of organisations. [Knowledge and Understanding, Learning, Communication]

+  Appreciate the impact of the changing technological landscape on modern information systems. [Knowledge and Understanding, Learning, Reflection]

+  Critically analyse the role of information systems in achieving operational excellence, enhancing decision making, and planning strategy in organisations. [Learning, Analysis, Problem Solving, Communication]
